newsitem.title: ITALY: U.S. military would join air drop in Zaire - Perry.
newsitem.headline: U.S. military would join air drop in Zaire - Perry.

text.p: U.S. Defence Secretary William Perry said on Wednesday that the United States was prepared to take part in a Canadian proposal for a military parachute drop of food to thousands of Rwandan refugees in Zaire.

"If they move forward with the air drop operation, we would certainly be in there as a full participant in it. And we are positioned to do that right now," Perry told reporters travelling with him to Italy on the first leg of a globe- circling trip.
Canada, impatient with indecision on the eastern Zaire refugee crisis, proposed on Tuesday that a military headquarters for refugee relief operations be set up in neighbouring Uganda.
Foreign Minister Lloyd Axworthy, announcing the proposal in Ottawa, also said Canada was pushing for air drops in Zaire to help those most affected.

While more than a half-million Rwandan refugees have eased the crisis by recently returning to their country from camps in neighbouring Zaire, relief experts estimate that several hundred thousand Rwandans remain displaced in Zaire and could face hunger and disease if they are not helped.

Perry cautioned on Wednesday that any multi-national military effort led by Canada would have to get permission from Zaire, Uganda and Rwanda in order to send cargo planes in at low altitude to drop supplies in Zaire.
